ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Continuing on the Italian track, I gained more conversational experience in the language. Additionally, there was a great deal of cultural topics incorporated in the course.
Gained more understanding and comprehension of italian

Advanced practice in grammar and vocabulary in both speaking, reading, and writing. Intense review of many L2 Italian concepts along with extensions and complexities of them. Also used more advanced cultural exploration materials from media (most notably literature and film)

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This is an especially difficult course to conduct strictly over Zoom. That is really my only fault with this course.

Strengths: Anna is a wonderful teacher and incredibly understanding. She organized the class to maximize our learning while also protecting against zoom fatigue (e.g. asynchronous Fridays). She also doesn't marry herself to the textbook the way other professors do, and I found this much more engaging

Weaknesses: same as every Yale language class  class every day, especially on zoom, feels

Anna is the sweetest professor in the world. She totally made the class. She was incredibly understanding during Covid and genuinely cared about all of us. Couldn't imagine a better and kinder professor. She's also great at teaching the material, and I feel like I learned a ton even during Covid.

Strengths: always Anna !!!! Fantastic professor who cares so much. Loved to be in class with her. She has an effectively structured course with no busy-work that many other classes have. 

Weaknesses: honestly I there aren't any glaring ones, but sometimes the films were difficult to watch/complete

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The use of asynchronous activities was helpful and successful.
I enjoyed the asynchronous Fridays and I really enjoyed the films we watched
The Friday podcasts were great to have a break from Zoom class and dive into an interesting topic.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I highly recommend Italian courses, as the department is awesome, the language is not too difficult, and there are a lot of interesting topics relating to the culture.
If you have liked Italian so far Id highly recommend taking l4 !
If you're interested in learning the language, take it

Absolutely. Anna is incredible and the material is interesting but not super challenging. A really nice way to continue with a language. No final exam and the grammar stuff is mostly review from L1 and L2. Amazing class.

Absolutely, Anna is great but also the class has a very relaxed feel that allows you to really learn and get your work done without unnecessary stress. A great way to improve and polish your Italian skills. Confidence in speaking really gets built in this class

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: asynchronous, project-based assignments (watching films, recording oral presentations, etc)
